title: A note on maximal operators for the Schrödinger equation on $\mathbb{T}^1.$
abstract: Motivated by the study of the maximal operator for the Schrödinger equation on the one-dimensional torus $ \mathbb{T}^1 $, it is conjectured that for any complex sequence $ \{b_n\}_{n=1}^N $, $$ \left\| \sup_{t\in [0,N^2]} \left|\sum_{n=1}^N b_n e \left(x\frac{n}{N} + t\frac{n^2}{N^2} \right) \right| \right\|_{L^4([0,N])} \leq C_εN^ε N^{\frac{1}{2}} \|b_n\|_{\ell^2} $$ In this note, we show that if we replace the sequence $ \{\frac{n^2}{N^2}\}_{n=1}^N $ by an arbitrary sequence $ \{a_n\}_{n=1}^N $ with only some convex properties, then $$ \left\| \sup_{t\in [0,N^2]} \left|\sum_{n=1}^N b_n e \left(x\frac{n}{N} + ta_n \right) \right| \right\|_{L^4([0,N])} \leq C_εN^εN^{\frac{7}{12}} \|b_n\|_{\ell^2}. $$ We further show that this bound is sharp up to a $C_εN^ε$ factor.
